p: To determine whether the bortezomib-induced changes in CHIKV protein levels extended to other proteasome inhibitors as well, we treated CHIKV-infected cells with a number of other proteasome inhibitors carrying different functional groups. Similar to bortezomib, treatment with MG132, MLN2238, lactacystin or ONX-0914 resulted in a reduction in band intensities of capsid (22% to 62% decrease) and nsP3 (9% to 29% decrease) at 6 hpi ( Fig 7). Likewise, band intensities of nsP4 were 200% to 260% greater in inhibitor-treated samples when compared against vehicle controls ( Fig 7). This suggests that anti-CHIKV mechanisms of proteasome inhibitors are likely to involve the same pathways, despite differences in functional groups.
